newsitem.title: INDIA: Delhi shares strong ahead of settlement.
newsitem.headline: Delhi shares strong ahead of settlement.

text.p: Delhi shares increased gains in afternoon trade as foreign and domestic investors bought selective stocks and speculators covered short positions ahead of fortnightly settlement on Friday , brokers said.
At 12.45 p.m. (0715 GMT), the Delhi bourse's sensitive index was up 3.6 points to 909.03. It was 2.61 points higher in early trade.
Hindustan Lever gained 28 rupees to 1,438 on buying by foreign investors, brokers said.

ITC Ltd climbed one rupee to 518.50 rupees. In early trade ITC had surged 10.50 rupees on reports that the company had reported a 34 percent jump in net profit for the first quarter of 1997/98 (April-March) ending June 30, 1997.
BSES Ltd edged up 0.70 rupee to 238.
